items.title: `winer redirect back to application from `cy.origin`
After initial Auth0 successful login, using cy.visit() redirects to Auth0 login page
items.body:
### Current behavior

I am using Auth0 for user authorisation, so when the website is accessed, it redirects to the Auth0 login page before redirecting back to the website as a logged in user.

With the introduction of `cy.origin` in Cypress v12, I was hoping change the tests to login to the website via username/password as a user would rather than doing it programatically since multiple origins weren't allowed before.

The tests successfully login via Auth0 with this method, however any execution of `cy.visit` seems to break the authorised state and triggers the callback flow leading to the Auth0 login page.

### Desired behavior

Since authorisation is successful at the start of the test, using `cy.visit` thereafter within the site should work as expected

### Test code to reproduce

Followed the [Auth0 for Cypress documentation](https://docs.cypress.io/guides/end-to-end-testing/auth0-authentication#What-you-ll-learn) which works correctly for initial authorisation

Any `cy.visit` command executed after initial authorisation leads to the issue

### Cypress Version

12.3.0

### Node version

v14.20.0

### Operating System

macOS 12.6

### Debug Logs

_No response_

### Other

there are a few issues that could relate to this: [1](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/issues/25289), [2](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/issues/20476), [3](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/issues/25373) however in my instance, initial authorisation is actually successful

I have tried the workaround of [modifying the cookies with an intercept](https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/issues/20476#issuecomment-1298486439) but this didn't work either

items.title: Skipped test clears the runner after finishing
items.body:
### Current behavior

When using the interactive runner, state is cleared _before_ each test and the state in which the runner _finished_ in, is a state where I can play around with the application.

However, under certain conditions, the presence of a skipped test ensures that the application is cleared after finish, as seen below.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/730419/211194031-cee86448-e3be-45d9-8e9b-4b01c6a53d71.png)


### Desired behavior

_No response_

### Test code to reproduce

https://github.com/badeball/cypress-reproducible-issues/tree/master/last-skipped-test

### Cypress Version

v12.3.0

### Node version

v19.3.0

### Operating System

Arch Linux

### Debug Logs

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

items.title: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'createElement')
items.body:
### Current behavior

```
HTTP/2 server listening on port: 4434

====================================================================================================

  (Run Starting)

  ┌────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
  │ Cypress:        12.3.0                                                                         │
  │ Browser:        Electron 106 (headless)                                                        │
  │ Node Version:   v18.8.0 (/usr/local/bin/node)                                                  │
  │ Specs:          8 found (checkSellerConsoleForError.spec.js, loginSeller.spec.js, loginSellerA │
  │                 dmin.spec.js, loginSellerAdminAndAdminMenu.spec.js, loginSellerNoAdmin.spec.js │
  │                 , loginSellerNoAdminNoAdminMenu.spec.js, registerSeller.spec.js, sellerShouldS │
  │                 eeManagementOverviews....)                                                     │
  │ Searched:       cypress/integration/*.spec.{js,jsx,ts,tsx}                                     │
  └────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘


────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
                                                                                                    
  Running:  checkSellerConsoleForError.spec.js                                              (1 of 8)
Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'createElement')
TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'createElement')
    at y (<embedded>:2849:169748)
    at new j (<embedded>:2849:166556)
    at S.setRunnables (<embedded>:4519:15381)
    at Object.onTestsReceivedAndMaybeRecord (<embedded>:4566:424652)
    at p.<anonymous> (<embedded>:4566:66394)
    at p.emit (node:events:527:28)
    at p.emitUntyped (<embedded>:4277:84346)
    at <embedded>:4277:91863
    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:78:11)

```

### Desired behavior

No error.

### Test code to reproduce

```
describe('Check Seller Platform for console errors', () => {
  it('Should be no console errors for the Seller platform', () => {
    cy.visit('/')
    cy.window()
      .its('console')
      .then((console) => {
        cy.stub(console, 'log').callsFake((...args) => {
          args.forEach.each((arg) => {
            expect(String(arg)).to.not.contain('error')
          })
          console.log.wrappedMethod(...args)
        })
      })
    // eslint-disable-next-line cypress/no-unnecessary-waiting
    cy.wait(2000)
  })
})
```

### Cypress Version

12.3.0

### Node version

v18.8.0

### Operating System

Ubuntu 22.10

### Debug Logs

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

items.title: Data from cy.invoke() stored in alias is removed on page navigation
items.body:
### Current behavior

When I take a text from page using `cy.invoke('text')` and save it to alias, it disappears on page navigation, see following code:
```js
cy.visit('/')

cy.get('[data-cy=board-item]')
    .invoke('text')
    .as('boardName')

// navigates to "/board/1" on same origin
 cy.get('[data-cy=board-item]')
    .click()
    
   cy.get('@boardName')
    .then((boardName) => {
      console.log(boardName) // undefined
    })
```

strangely enough, when I use `cy.go('back')` and then try to retrieve data from alias, it’s there. seems to be a regression, works in v11.0.0

### Desired behavior

_No response_

### Test code to reproduce

https://github.com/filiphric/invoke-bug

### Cypress Version

12.3.0

### Node version

v16

### Operating System

macos

### Debug Logs

_No response_

### Other

_No response_
